website_summaries.verdict: For the neutral road runner who wants a lot of cushioning.
pros: Has a lot of midsole cushioning and delivers a responsive ride
The generously padded midsole protects users from impact
Attractive design makes the shoe fun to wear
cons: Narrow fit won't suit all runners

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of the v7’s on a whim at a NB store. Told the salesperson that I was an ASICS guy for the past 25 years because of the comfortable toe box. He told me that I might like the v7 and he wasn’t wrong. I am in my 60s, weigh 215, and walk briskly every morning (5k in 45 minutes). These shoes are more supportive and comfortable than my ASICS. As a result, I purchased another pair and might get a third with wild colors just for grins. I guess that an old dog can learn a new trick or two; I’m now a NB guy!
customer_reviews.author: James F. Fairbank

customer_reviews.title: Saved My Feet!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes saved my feet. I am a supinator ( under-pronator ) and I always wear out shoes at the outer edge. I was suffering from agonizing Plantar Fascitis, and it looked like I was going to be a cripple. I tried various arch supports, nothing really helped. A week or so of wearing these shoes - my PF just went away. Best $140 I ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Kaidor

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly and only 1/10 shoes fit me. Also stays shiny as long as you don’t step in mud
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for 4 months and they’re absolutely great! I can hip-hop dance in these fine too in addition to running. The shoes stay clean and shiny if you don’t step in mud or something.
customer_reviews.author: Nga Duong

customer_reviews.title: The show looks great, and is comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The show looks great, and is comfortable, however, when wearing the shoes, my feet hurt due to the tongue of the shoe not proper The show looks great, and is comfortable, however, when wearing the shoes, my feet hurt due to the tongue of the shoe Improperly being attached. I’ve never had a problem like this in the past, but would not recommend issue due to this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nick DeNicola

customer_reviews.title: Fit good but be conscious of the foot bed fit and rubbing.
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected and feel very light. Would rate higher but having a real problem with the heel cup/foot bed. Wearing/rubbing holes on the inside of both heels. I wear very good running socks and run on average 75 miles a month. Only the second time I have had this issue with a pair of shoes. Yes, I have had my gait reviewed and this is my second pair of this same shoe, the last pair had no issues and if I put them back on no rubbing in the heel areas. I should have returned and tried another pair.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: I have worn the 1080 and its predecessors for more years than I can count and have been very pleased with them
customer_reviews.text: I am still unsure about this new "no sew" style of the 1080. I have worn the 1080 and its predecessors for more years than I can count and have been very pleased with them. The pair I got has an annoying outboard upturn twist in the left toe that hurts my little toe, and I have never had that problem before and I think it is a quality defect. I am hoping that it will fix itself as I wear them in. They are otherwise a good fit, cushioned as I expect, and run well. I have not had them long enough to judge how quickly they wear.
customer_reviews.author: Roland C Myers

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes just not for me
customer_reviews.text: These are great running shoes. However, everyone’s foot is different and differences can be especially noticed when running long distances. These were super comfortable and were very stable for running. However, the style of arch support ended up giving me blisters on the balls of my feet. I tried running in them on a treadmill a few times and the blisters kept coming. These may work great for you and they seem like a well-made shoe, just not for me
customer_reviews.author: Alice Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes at a good price. Very comfortable for my old tired feet. I have very high arches and have additional arch supports in these shoes and find them to be the most comfortable shoe yet for walking. I tend to come down hard on my heels and these take all jarring out. Size is exactly correct.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, great price
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fit exactly like the pair I have been using. Very light and comfortable. I had a stroke and need to wear a brace on my left foot. I have been using a pair as my go to everyday shoe. Had been looking for a replacement and the price was incredible.

customer_reviews.title: These shows are great. You should really try them on in a ...
customer_reviews.text: These shows are great. You should really try them on in a store first as they are a smaller fit. I am usually a size 9, but need a 9.5 2E in this model of running shoe. This was my second pair so I knew what to expect. I find them very comfortable. They give me good arch support and stability on the heel as the base flares out to provide a wider stepping platform. I am not a runner, but I do use these almost everyday on my treadmill and elliptical and as an everyday walking shoe.

customer_reviews.title: If you are a senior citizen...
customer_reviews.text: I moved away from New Balance basketball sneakers a while ago as they started to be designed for the "mature" crowd. Ordered these running shoes to give them another shot. WOW. They feel like they are made by a podiatrist for my grandfather. Running shoe...no, old guy slow walking shoes. Do yourself a favor if you actually plan on running. Go with Asics. These are fitted weirdly, curved upwards and feel like they are those shoes Kramer wore in Seinfeld. Not for me. Maybe my dad in 10 years.

customer_reviews.title: Possibly Seconds
customer_reviews.text: This is a shame. I really liked these. Very comfortable and a good fit but the shoe was defective. It was an "unbalanced" New Balance. When you put the left shoe on the floor, it wobbled. The rubber was deformed. I think these may have been seconds. I really wanted to reorder because I liked these so much but I don't want to get in a loop of try on and return until I'm fed up. I figured I'd just get more defective footwear from this vendor. I, sadly, just sent them back and didn't reorder.

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam 1080 V7 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Meet our premiere cushioning story in fresh foam. The fresh foam 1080 carries forward the plush ride and inherently stable footprint of its award-winning predecessor with additional data points to help maximize cushioning on your run.
